pullRequest.body:
`Real.pow_sum_div_card_le_sum_pow` and `NNReal.pow_sum_div_card_le_sum_pow` both state that `(‚àë i in s, f i) ^ (n + 1) / s.card ^ n ‚â§ ‚àë i in s, f i ^ (n + 1)`, but one for `f : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù` and the other for `f : Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù‚â•0`.
Both lemmas can be unified by deriving the inequality for `f : Œπ ‚Üí Œ±` where `[LinearOrderedSemifield Œ±] [ExistsAddOfLE Œ±]`. This involves generalising the rearrangement inequality semirings.

From LeanAPAP

@eric-wieser, before you irremediably order me to split many things off this PR, can you tell me whether you are happy with the duplication in this file or if you want me to implement the scheme above.

The core issue is that...

... this inequality is still true if you replace `Œ≤` by `Œ≤·µí·µà`, but its assumptions are too strong to prove this. Indeed, `ExistsAddOfLE Œ≤` does not imply `ExistsAddOfLE Œ≤·µí·µà`

We would need a weaker typeclass which would imply this inequality and would be preserved under `·µí·µà`. `ExistsAddOrAddOfLE` in my TODO is one possible typeclass.
Should this have a deprecation?
I can't add it here because this file doesn't import `Algebra.Order.Chebyshev`

Then put it in another file; I think we should at least emit warnings for users of `import Mathlib`.

bors r-

bors d+
Sorry, I completely missed that comment
